channel.title: Blogs on Collin Hansen's Github Site
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Collin Hansen's Github Site

item.title: Gambling Comes Down to Trusting Your Gut
item.description: Lies. Deceit. Mistrust. All of these were things we faced in our NBA Playoffs Gambling Assignment for this semester of Advanced Sports Data and Analysis. Had we been more aware of these things, our group would’ve placed first in the class. Unfortunately, we were naive and placed trust where it didn’t belong, and we got burned for it. We somehow finished in third after successfully going all-in on the second-to-last night of bets.

item.title: March Sadness
item.description: This March, for the first time in my life, I filled out a March Madness bracket. While this may not be exciting news for many, it’s exciting to me. I’m not much of a college basketball guy at all. In fact, the most college basketball I had watched in my life before this March was catching the end of a few national championship games here and there in years past.

item.title: How Important was Ndamukong Suh To The Nebraska Defense?
item.description: Ndamukong Suh was, and still is, a force to be reckoned with on the football field. He was one of the most dominant college players to ever play his position, and has carried that legacy with him into the NFL. Opposing teams feared him during his time at Nebraska. Opposing offensive lineman were petrified heading into their games against Nebraska, scrambling their minds trying to figure out any way to stop Suh.

item.title: Is it time to jump ship on Scott Frost?
item.description: Nebraska football has arguably the most loyal fans in all of college athletics. The sense of pride in their football program is no different. Fans of Nebraska will support the team until the day they die, but many have begun to lose hope in Scott Frost returning the team to glory. Scott Frost is the hometown hero that came back to Nebraska and won a national championship, and he’s the one that came back to Nebraska yet again to try and help them win even more as a coach.
